fever.description: A viral infection causing fever, body aches, and respiratory symptoms.
fever.medications_or_advice: Antivirals like Oseltamivir (Tamiflu) if prescribed early, Acetaminophen or Ibuprofen for fever, rest, and hydration.

fever.description: A milder viral infection with fever, runny nose, and cough.
fever.medications_or_advice: Acetaminophen or Ibuprofen for fever, decongestants like Pseudoephedrine, rest, and fluids.

fever.description: A lung infection causing high fever, cough, and difficulty breathing.
fever.medications_or_advice: Antibiotics (e.g., Amoxicillin) for bacterial cases, fever reducers like Ibuprofen, oxygen therapy if severe; see a doctor.

fever.description: A parasitic infection with recurring fever, chills, and sweating.
fever.medications_or_advice: Antimalarial drugs (e.g., Chloroquine, Artemisinin-based therapy) prescribed by a doctor; seek medical attention.

cough.description: A viral infection with a dry or productive cough.
cough.medications_or_advice: Cough suppressants like Dextromethorphan, expectorants like Guaifenesin, honey, and warm fluids.

cough.description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes causing persistent cough.
cough.medications_or_advice: Cough syrups (e.g., Guaifenesin), Ibuprofen for inflammation, rest; antibiotics if bacterial (prescribed).

cough.description: A chronic condition with wheezing and coughing triggered by allergens.
cough.medications_or_advice: Inhaled corticosteroids (e.g., Fluticasone), bronchodilators (e.g., Albuterol), avoid triggers.

cough.description: A lung infection with cough, often with phlegm.
cough.medications_or_advice: Antibiotics (e.g., Azithromycin) for bacterial cases, cough medicine, rest; seek medical care.

headache.description: Stress-related head pain, often a tight band-like sensation.
headache.medications_or_advice: Ibuprofen, Acetaminophen, stress management, and relaxation techniques.

headache.description: Severe, throbbing headache often with nausea or light sensitivity.
headache.medications_or_advice: Triptans (e.g., Sumatriptan), Ibuprofen, dark quiet room, avoid triggers.

headache.description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing headache and facial pressure.
headache.medications_or_advice: Decongestants (e.g., Pseudoephedrine), nasal saline spray, antibiotics if bacterial (prescribed).

headache.description: High blood pressure that may cause morning headaches.
headache.medications_or_advice: Antihypertensives (e.g., Lisinopril), lifestyle changes (e.g., reduce salt), consult a doctor.

fatigue.description: A viral infection causing extreme tiredness.
fatigue.medications_or_advice: Rest, hydration, Acetaminophen for discomfort, antivirals if prescribed.

fatigue.description: Low red blood cell count leading to persistent fatigue.
fatigue.medications_or_advice: Iron supplements, Vitamin B12, dietary changes (e.g., more red meat), consult a doctor.

fatigue.description: Unexplained, long-term exhaustion not relieved by rest.
fatigue.medications_or_advice: Pacing activities, cognitive behavioral therapy, no specific medication; medical guidance needed.

fatigue.description: High blood sugar levels causing energy loss.
fatigue.medications_or_advice: Metformin, insulin if prescribed, balanced diet, regular monitoring.

sore throat.description: A bacterial infection causing painful swallowing and fever.
sore throat.medications_or_advice: Antibiotics (e.g., Penicillin, Amoxicillin), throat lozenges, warm salt water gargle.

sore throat.description: A viral infection with mild sore throat and congestion.
sore throat.medications_or_advice: Throat lozenges, honey and lemon, hydration, rest.

sore throat.description: Inflammation of the tonsils causing throat pain.
sore throat.medications_or_advice: Antibiotics if bacterial (e.g., Amoxicillin), pain relievers like Ibuprofen, rest.

sore throat.description: Postnasal drip from allergies irritating the throat.
sore throat.medications_or_advice: Antihistamines (e.g., Cetirizine), nasal saline rinse, avoid allergens.

runny nose.description: A viral infection with nasal congestion and discharge.
runny nose.medications_or_advice: Decongestants (e.g., Phenylephrine), antihistamines, saline spray, rest.

runny nose.description: Seasonal or perennial reaction causing clear nasal discharge.
runny nose.medications_or_advice: Antihistamines (e.g., Loratadine), nasal corticosteroids (e.g., Fluticasone), avoid triggers.

runny nose.description: Sinus inflammation with thick nasal discharge.
runny nose.medications_or_advice: Decongestants, nasal saline, antibiotics if bacterial (prescribed).

nausea.description: Stomach flu with nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
nausea.medications_or_advice: Rehydration salts, antiemetics (e.g., Ondansetron if prescribed), bland diet.

nausea.description: Severe headache often accompanied by nausea.
nausea.medications_or_advice: Antiemetics (e.g., Metoclopramide), Ibuprofen, rest in a dark room.

nausea.description: Bacterial contamination causing nausea and stomach upset.
nausea.medications_or_advice: Hydration, Bismuth Subsalicylate (Pepto-Bismol), avoid solid food initially.

nausea.description: Morning sickness with nausea in early stages.
nausea.medications_or_advice: Ginger, Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine), small frequent meals, consult a doctor.

diarrhea.description: Viral or bacterial infection causing watery stools.
diarrhea.medications_or_advice: Oral rehydration salts, Loperamide (Imodium) if advised, bland diet.

diarrhea.description: Contaminated food leading to diarrhea and cramps.
diarrhea.medications_or_advice: Hydration, Bismuth Subsalicylate, rest; see a doctor if severe.

diarrhea.description: Chronic condition with diarrhea and abdominal pain.
diarrhea.medications_or_advice: Antispasmodics (e.g., Hyoscyamine), fiber supplements, dietary changes.

shortness of breath.medications_or_advice: Bronchodilators (e.g., Albuterol), inhaled corticosteroids (e.g., Budesonide), avoid triggers.
Antibiotics (e.g., Levofloxacin) for bacterial cases, oxygen therapy, rest; seek medical care.
Breathing exercises, anti-anxiety meds (e.g., Lorazepam) if prescribed, therapy.

joint pain.description: Joint inflammation causing pain and stiffness.
joint pain.medications_or_advice: NSAIDs (e.g., Naproxen), physical therapy, heat/cold therapy.

joint pain.description: Viral infection with body aches including joints.
joint pain.medications_or_advice: Acetaminophen, rest, hydration, antivirals if early.

joint pain.description: Tick-borne illness with joint pain and swelling.
joint pain.medications_or_advice: Antibiotics (e.g., Doxycycline), pain relievers, consult a doctor.

rash.description: Skin reaction to allergens causing redness or hives.
rash.medications_or_advice: Antihistamines (e.g., Diphenhydramine), hydrocortisone cream, avoid allergens.

rash.description: Viral infection with a distinctive red rash.
rash.medications_or_advice: Supportive care (rest, hydration), Vitamin A if severe, consult a doctor.

rash.description: Chronic skin condition with itchy, inflamed patches.
rash.medications_or_advice: Moisturizers, topical steroids (e.g., Hydrocortisone), avoid irritants.

chest pain.description: Chest pain from reduced heart blood flow.
chest pain.medications_or_advice: Nitroglycerin, beta-blockers (e.g., Metoprolol), seek immediate medical help.

chest pain.description: Acid reflux causing burning chest pain.
chest pain.medications_or_advice: Antacids (e.g., Tums), PPIs (e.g., Omeprazole), avoid spicy foods.
Antibiotics if bacterial, pain relievers, rest; see a doctor.

dizziness.medications_or_advice: Oral rehydration solutions, water, rest in a cool place.

dizziness.description: Inner ear issue causing spinning sensation.
dizziness.medications_or_advice: Meclizine, vestibular exercises, avoid sudden movements.

dizziness.description: Low blood pressure leading to dizziness.
dizziness.medications_or_advice: Increase salt intake, hydration, compression stockings; consult a doctor.

abdominal pain.medications_or_advice: Hydration, bland diet, antispasmodics (e.g., Dicyclomine) if needed.

abdominal pain.description: Inflammation of the appendix with sharp pain.
abdominal pain.medications_or_advice: Surgery (appendectomy), antibiotics, seek immediate medical help.

abdominal pain.description: Chronic digestive issue with abdominal discomfort.
abdominal pain.medications_or_advice: Fiber supplements, antispasmodics, dietary changes (e.g., low FODMAP).

itchy eyes.description: Reaction to pollen or dust causing eye irritation.
itchy eyes.medications_or_advice: Antihistamine eye drops (e.g., Ketotifen), oral antihistamines, avoid allergens.

itchy eyes.description: Eye infection or inflammation with itching.
itchy eyes.medications_or_advice: Antibiotic drops if bacterial, warm compresses, good hygiene.

itchy eyes.description: Insufficient tear production causing itchy eyes.
itchy eyes.medications_or_advice: Artificial tears, omega-3 supplements, humidifier use.

chills.description: Viral infection with fever and shaking chills.
chills.medications_or_advice: Acetaminophen, rest, warm blankets, antivirals if prescribed.

chills.description: Parasitic infection with cyclical chills and fever.
chills.medications_or_advice: Antimalarials (e.g., Artemisinin), fever reducers, seek medical care.

chills.description: Bacterial infection with chills, especially if it reaches the kidneys.
chills.medications_or_advice: Antibiotics (e.g., Nitrofurantoin), hydration, see a doctor.

sweating.description: Overactive thyroid causing excessive sweating and heat intolerance.
sweating.medications_or_advice: Antithyroid drugs (e.g., Methimazole), beta-blockers, consult a doctor.

sweating.description: Parasitic infection with fever and profuse sweating.
Hormonal changes causing night sweats and hot flashes.
sweating.medications_or_advice: Hormone replacement therapy (if advised), cooling techniques, lifestyle changes.

loss of appetite.description: Stomach infection reducing desire to eat.
loss of appetite.medications_or_advice: Hydration, bland diet (e.g., BRAT), gradual refeeding.
Antidepressants (e.g., SSRIs), therapy, small frequent meals.

loss of appetite.description: Liver inflammation causing nausea and appetite loss.
loss of appetite.medications_or_advice: Supportive care, antivirals if chronic (e.g., Sofosbuvir), medical supervision.

muscle cramps.description: Fluid and electrolyte imbalance causing cramps.
Low potassium levels leading to muscle spasms.
muscle cramps.medications_or_advice: Potassium supplements, bananas/oranges, consult a doctor.

muscle cramps.description: Chronic condition with widespread pain and cramps.
muscle cramps.medications_or_advice: Pain relievers (e.g., Pregabalin), exercise, stress reduction.

swollen lymph nodes.description: Bacterial infection with tender neck nodes.
Viral infection causing swollen glands and fatigue.
swollen lymph nodes.medications_or_advice: Rest, hydration, pain relievers; avoid contact sports.

swollen lymph nodes.description: Cancer of the lymphatic system with persistent node swelling.
swollen lymph nodes.medications_or_advice: Chemotherapy, radiation, biopsy needed; seek immediate medical care.

blurred vision.description: High blood sugar affecting eye blood vessels.
blurred vision.medications_or_advice: Blood sugar control (e.g., Insulin), regular eye exams, consult a doctor.

blurred vision.description: Visual aura preceding headache with blurry spots.
Eye pressure causing gradual vision loss.
blurred vision.medications_or_advice: Eye drops (e.g., Latanoprost), surgery if severe, urgent care needed.

palpitations.medications_or_advice: Relaxation techniques, beta-blockers if prescribed, therapy.
Antithyroid meds (e.g., Propylthiouracil), beta-blockers, medical evaluation.

palpitations.description: Irregular heart rhythm with noticeable beats.
palpitations.medications_or_advice: Antiarrhythmics (e.g., Amiodarone), pacemaker if needed, consult a cardiologist.

weight loss.medications_or_advice: Antithyroid drugs (e.g., Methimazole), nutritional support, doctor visit.

weight loss.description: Uncontrolled blood sugar causing unintentional weight loss.
weight loss.medications_or_advice: Insulin or Metformin, balanced diet, regular monitoring.

weight loss.description: Various types may cause unexplained weight loss.
weight loss.medications_or_advice: Depends on type (e.g., chemotherapy), nutritional support, urgent medical evaluation.

frequent urination.description: High blood sugar increasing urine output.
frequent urination.medications_or_advice: Blood sugar management (e.g., Metformin), hydration, doctor consultation.

frequent urination.description: Bladder infection causing urgent, frequent urination.
Benign condition in men increasing urination frequency.
frequent urination.medications_or_advice: Alpha-blockers (e.g., Tamsulosin), surgery if severe, consult a urologist.

dry mouth.description: High blood sugar causing dry mouth and thirst.
dry mouth.medications_or_advice: Blood sugar control (e.g., Insulin), sugar-free gum, hydration.
Artificial saliva, pilocarpine if prescribed, manage symptoms with a doctor.
